name: places/ChIJAUpgiVJYwokR65-11Un7aCU
formattedAddress: 420 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 420 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text:
I have lived in some of the top condo in Manhattan but got tired of paying 5-7k for a 1 bedroom.  I was thinking of finally moving out of the city, and after viewing this unique looking building for 4 years, I decided to stop in, and was pleasantly surprised to see how nice it was inside.

I see the prior complaints about maintenance and management, and it is laughable.  There was a  period of time where they upgraded the elevators and it was definitely an inconvenience as they had to be upgraded one by one.   Maintenance is EXTREMELY responsive and management is perhaps too responsive if that is a thing.

The staff is great, the doormen are all polite and friendly and there is a secure package room. Finally, the leasing department is honest and transparent, which is highly unusual for NYC and much appreciated.

originalText.text: While I do not live here, I do work in housing and understand how important quality/respectful staff can make on residents and their guest experiences. Fate required I seek immediate/urgent assistance from the doorman who referred me to the front desk staff yesterday. When I say the gentlemen were so kind, helpful and respectful-- I mean that to the point I had to look up the address and leave a review. Thank you both.

originalText.text: The worst building I had experience living in! Main reason STAFF. The most incompetent and rude. I’m ashamed to bring guests in my house because of them. Sometimes they smoke RIGHT IN FRONT ( I do not discriminate and I’m extremely understanding person but really, can you walk away with your cigarette from me at least) of the entrance. Maybe few guys only out of many are actually doing their jobs but it doesn't change the situation overall . Forget about getting your stuff fixed as well.  Management wont be helpful as well. PLEASE do not move in in here.

originalText.text: Would not recommend living here - the management company lures tenants in with a teaser rent for the first year then jacks it up after the year concludes without providing any reasoning (happened to me and and a friend living in the building as well). They also don't allow flex walls to go to the ceiling and force you to use their own provider which has a wall design that wastes space. The staff are by far the most redeeming quality of the building and are incredibly user friendly. The amenities are subpar, with a tiny gym lacking basic equipment (but it s free), and a "roof deck" but on the fifth floor facing the Lincoln Tunnel. Apartments have stainless steel appliances but in terms of design everything is entry-level. Adequate if you're looking for a deal for one year to live in the city close to Times Sq but not incredibly noisy.

originalText.text: I had a terrible experience with them. I totally wasted my time.. You should be careful if you are applying for this apartment. Please be careful. I still can't believe they didn't try to fix what was wrong with us and reposted the unit priced up.(They didn't help and ignored). PS. they won't respond you until you push them.
